answerText: Gauss-Bonnet theorem[10] An easy application of the Gauss-Bonnet theorem is deriving Gauss's law by interpreting the curvature as field strength and noting that the surface integral must evaluate to this topological invariant, which is measured in Coulombs.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 2 | 17 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this theorem that most generally states that the surface integral of the curvature over a compact, oriented Riemannian 2-manifold is equal to two pi times the Euler characteristic of the manifold.
